result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Vue was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Arm Self w/ Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not fully engaged complete 3 job applications per week and 6 hours community service per week.

Counseling/assessments deemed appropriate by agent. AODA w/ follow up. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay any upaid court financial obligations.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  8:51 a.m. 
INCLUDES 17CF1441, 17CM475, 17CM835, 19CF1000.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. 
Defendant appears in person, pro se. 

Date and time set for hearing on request to reduce collection debt. 
COURT recites off record discussions with defendant; State does not take position on costs.  
COURT questions deft re: employment/income. 
Defendant makes statement; has also sent same request to all other Judge's regarding costs but has not heard back yet. 
COURT would like some time to discuss all of defendant's other cases with other branches before making a decision to act together on request. 

COURT does not make finding today. 
COURT sets hearing for 12/19/22 at 9:15 a.m. (Court will allow deft to request to appear by video, if needed).

Adj:  8:56 a.m.

Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 9:57 a.m. 
INCLUDES: 14CF484, 14CM1578, 15CF872, 15TR4744, 15TR5873.
State appears by ADA Alex Lech in person. Defendant FAILS to appear.
Date and time set for hearing re: Request to reduce debt and payment plan.
VRCW. 

COURT notes defendant has appeared previously, he did follow the COURT's previous order and submitted a letter explaining debts to COURT.
ADA Lech objects to any reduction in restitution, has no position re: forfeitted bonds.
COURT ORDERS:
14CF484: regarding the $5000 signature bond forfeited - COURT vacates any outstanding debt of the bond forfeiture. 
15CF872 - regarding the $5000 signature bond forfeited - COURT vacates any outstanding debt of the bond forfeiture. 
All other bond forfeitures, court costs and restitution to remain, all payments to go towards restitution first. 

Adjourned: 10:01 a.m.
Hearing on September 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 3:10 p.m. 
**Includes 14CF484 & 14CM1578**
State appears by ADA Elisabeth Gramer. Defendant appears in person with Atty Robin Kennedy. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed. VRCW.
Victim Impact Statement filed. State notes preliminary hearing needs to be addressed in 14CF484. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed in 14CF484.
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived. State proceeds with plea & sentencing. 
State moves to: 14CF484- DRI Ct.2 Theft- Movable Property. 14CM1578- DRI Ct.2 Possess Drug Para. 
COURT GRANTS. 
PLEA: 14CF484- Ct.1 Burglary- Arm Self w/Dangerous Weapon(PTAC)>>GUILTY
           14CM1578- Ct.1 Possession of THC>>GUILTY 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty on Ct.1 in 14CM1578 and withholds finding on Ct.1 in 14CF484. 
COURT ORDERS: 14CM1578- Ct.1 SWH, probation for 1 year. CONDITIONS: Complete any assessment, treatment and counseling as deemed appropriate by agent, AODA & any follow-up, 10-15 hours of CS every week with 5 verifiable job contacts provided to DA's office until defendant obtains/maintains full time employment, schooling or a combination of both, letter of apology to victim; C.G., joint & several restitution in the amount of $4,902.00, CC & DNA surcharge. Probation shall not be extended for failure to pay if there has been a good faith effort. 14CF484- Ct.1 DEOJ for 2 years. COURT adopts and signs DEOJ agreement. If defendant successfully completes DEOJ, charge will be dismissed. Defendant is eligible for expungement once probation is successfully completed. 
Review Hearing: January 19th, 2017 at 1:10 p.m. in Br.2 Office.
Bond is continued on 14CF484.
